website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus M.Zuiko Digital ED 40-150mm f4.0-5.6 R is a solid budget option for Micro Four Thirds shooters looking for an affordable telephoto zoom lens.
pros: Sharp through most of its zoom range
cons: Performance suffers at the edges of the frame

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true -- but it's true!
customer_reviews.text: Others have said it more eloquently than I could, but I want to reiterate that this lens is completely amazing. The super-telephoto reach lets you grab those far off shots that would normally be missed, and it's also great for nature/flower photography. The slow aperture is not a big deal when shooting outdoors in decent light. The only negative is that the focusing is slow and with AF it can miss focus a lot, but I can't fault the lens for that when it costs $100!! I'll just let some recent photos I took speak for themselves. (Camera used: Olympus EM5 Mark II)
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: For a hundred bucks, you can't go wrong getting this lens!
customer_reviews.text: For a hundred bucks, you can't go wrong with this lens! Second to the standard 14-42 mm lens this is probably one of the most versatile lenses you can get for your camera. It lets you get close up on action and wildlife. I'm using my lens with an Olympus E-PL5 and my pictures are with no filters or attachments. It does a great job with high speed sporting photography and it is even pretty decent at closeup macro photography. Update: I used this lens to capture the 2017 Total solar Eclipse. I was able to capture solar flares during totality. I'm really impressed with this lens for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Derek DaileyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Don't get your hopes up too high but this is totally worth its cost for 90% of photographers
customer_reviews.text: What this is: An inexpensive wide range telephoto lens great for bright outdoor photography (even bright sports photography) What this isn't: A pro lens, a low light lens or a "do everything" lens The condition, lighting must be good to use it at full zoom otherwise even with image stabilization the picture quality will suffer.
customer_reviews.author: Bugalydosh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little zoom lens!
customer_reviews.text: Got it during a holiday sale for 99 bucks....definitely a great decision, this lens punches way above that price point. I also have the Olympus 12-40mm PRO lens, and while that gives obviously superior images (I tested the same shot with both at 40mm), the gap isn't nearly as big as the price difference might indicate. Yes, this doesn't open particularly wide, so it's not suited to indoor or dimly lit shots... but if you just want a cheap, compact telephoto, I can't think of anything better. One final note: even though it's entirely plastic, the build quality feels surprisingly solid.
customer_reviews.author: TJTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: ... of plastic and i'm afraid of it breaking so easily.. standard lens hood doesn't fit on it ...
customer_reviews.text: Feels a cheap because it's made of plastic and i'm afraid of it breaking so easily.. standard lens hood doesn't fit on it which is a shame. Takes beautiful photos, though it can be tough with a Panasonic body and an Olympus lens because Panasonic has OIS built into the lens and Olympus has it built into the body.. which means no OIS for this lens on a Panasonic body. Still, it can take nice photos if you mind the shake or use a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: DesuIsSparta

customer_reviews.title: It's just not sharp at all.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for several years. I also have a range of other Olympus lenses for the EM1 and EM10 M2, including the 12- 40 Pro, and a couple of primes . My favorite is the 14-42 EZ pancake. It's convenient, and very sharp. This 40-150 is a totally different story. It's not close to being sharp. Maybe I have a defective unit. Rarely use it because the results are so disappointing. Tried it again recently on vacation. Same results. After my latest efforts with it, I'm not going to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: DC-Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Fair.
customer_reviews.text: Eh. I know it's affordable...but this isn't even really worth the $100. I recently took this lens to Europe and while I had some success with the lens, here is what I don't like: 1. Soft. This lens is not very sharp. Images are okay but not awesome. I don't want average photos. 2. Focusing. Doesn't like low light, doesn't like almost any light when fully extended. It's one thing to look at the lcd on your camera after the shot and think, cool. Totally another thing when it's up on your 27" screen and you think...ugh...that really sucks.
customer_reviews.author: M. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive telephoto lens!
customer_reviews.text: I admit that I opened my newly received lens with some misgivings based on some posted negative reviews, but am most pleasantly surprised. Both the zoom and focusing rings work very smoothly, It focuses reasonably quickly and Images are much more than merely acceptably sharp. Perhaps this is a good copy. On the downside, the EVF images are not very bright, as expected for a lens of this limited speed. This lens is small and LIGHT, making it a very handy candidate for travel. I surely got my $99 worth!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent m43 light-weight long-range lens
customer_reviews.text: I'm hardly a professional, and I've only recently begun taking my Nikon G7 seriously, but this lens has become invaluable in a single day. I shoot a lot of debates and it's nice to be able to get good shots from a distance, without getting in anyone's way. However, getting enough light is a challenge at the higher end of the focal length. Stabilization is fairly solid but tracking and shooting is best done sitting or on a tripod. Thing is, it's light and gets the job done. And it's cheap. It won't be the fastest or the cleanest but it's given me options I didn't have before. Definitely will be using this a lot.
customer_reviews.author: SteelerfaninPeru

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for the price
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It’s a low cost solution for zoom and it’s worth the low price tag. If you can’t afford the real deal this is will get you by. Arrived without issue
customer_reviews.author: E. Feola

customer_reviews.title: Who know a lens this cheap could be this good?
customer_reviews.text: This lens is pretty much a must have lens for Olympus M4/3 camera users because it's such a screaming deal. It's truly great up to 100 mm and very good beyond that. Most of the time I'm using it to shoot wild life fully zoomed at 150mm and the pictures are amazing. It shoots best between f5.6 and F11 so it's not exactly a fast lens, but it focuses quickly (at least on my E-PL3) and is really sharp with great color. Is it a "Pro" lens? No, not really but mostly because it's kinda slow and isn't waterproofed. I can't imagine there's anything else out there that shoots as good and isn't at least 3x more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Quiet Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Competent low-cost long zoom
customer_reviews.text: Good for what it is -- increadibly low-cost, lightweight, and reasonable competent telephoto zoom lens for the m43 system. I purchased this lens to have a long zoom option in a lightweight kit (E-M5 II, 12-40 pro, and this zoom), and it does the job. Normally I use the 40-150 pro, which is much bigger and heavier and has some of the best image quality of any lens in the system. Don't expect that kind of performance and you'll be fine. It's got decent plastic construction, not the best Olympus does but not too bad, nicely damped focus ring, and a fairly smooth zoom ring that could be a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ruggeri

customer_reviews.title: For the price, excellent
customer_reviews.text: As far as cheap glass goes, this is a great value. I wanted to use my new camera right away, but didn't have a Micro Four Thirds lens or speed booster/adapter for any of my other lenses. This lens has turned out to be fantastic. I wouldn't rely it on for a professional shoot, but test shots, learning the camera, and self-projects this lens is doing everything I expect it to do. I wouldn't want to test it's durability though.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L

customer_reviews.title: Great sharp lens for a bargain price with a nice range & small / lightweight albeit slow in aperture
customer_reviews.text: A very slow lens in terms of aperture, but a nice lightweight small-footprint zoom which offers a great range from 80mm to 300mm on MFT for a very decent price. It is sharp at all ranges & focuses quickly with my Panasonic cameras. I've used it many times in places like churches or event halls which require higher ISO settings, for outdoors which is great at normal ISO settings. Highly recommended for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ChifanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great photos, Poor durability
customer_reviews.text: I loved shooting with this lense, it's east to learn & high quality photos. HOWEVER, after just a few months of very light use (only about 1x week), the lense stopped retracting and is totally unusable. I contacted the owner but they couldn't care less since I didn't purchase their warranty. It's sad, because it's a great lense. However, I would recommend getting a different lense that's more durable or has a seller that cares about his customers.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Moon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe this lens is as cheap as it is. High quality materials, effective image stabilization, and excellent optics. Sure, the max aperture is a bit small, but that’s how they drive down price. If you’re not needing paper thin bokeh, and have adequate light then you can’t beat this lens for this price for micro 4/3.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great when used at appropriate distance
customer_reviews.text: This lens works best 8-10 feet away. The Zoom is beautiful at that distance. Too far away and the image will be blurry. Too close and you will not be able to frame your shot correctly. I used it when we went to a nature preserve and got great shots of the birds that were close to ground level, including a cardinal hiding in a low branch.
customer_reviews.author: bbmac

customer_reviews.title: A combination of Micro 4/3 camera and smaller lenses make it a joy when using
customer_reviews.text: A must have lens to expand the range of picture possibility when shooting with your micro 4/3 camera. Beyond the kit lens 14-42 mm the 40-150mm will extend the use of your pictures with autofocus and exposer at a very reasonable price. The lens has a lot of plastic, but the weight is lite and takes decent quality images for its size. The size of my camera bag is now 1/2 its size from when shooting with my Sony DSLR. A combination of Micro 4/3 camera and smaller lenses make it a joy when using.
customer_reviews.author: RPD

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic AG AF 100
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for the price. Got it to use with a Panasonic AG AF 100 and a GH1. With the AG100: The lens has no OIS or Mega OIS...a tripod is a must. Lens looks clean and sharp. Autofocus is incredibly slow with the AG100. Don't expect to use it in a fast pace situation. Nice option as an extra lens with this particular setup. Others have mentioned it is mainly made of plastic and thats true but the outer barrel feels like metal and the gears in the focus and zoom feel smooth. I plan on using this for stationary objects for extreme close up shots.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Gibson

customer_reviews.title: first llense.
customer_reviews.text: Must have to open the world of photography. Used to take some basic movies, video my nephew at his basketball game and family photos. Better lenses for sporting events but I love the quality of photos I get. Great starter and love the price point.
customer_reviews.author: greenwolf

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it already!
customer_reviews.text: It has all been said, this is the best value in Micro Four Thirds lens lineups period. If you have a kit lens that ends around 40MM, this picks up where you left off and does so with quality that belies its price. Can be used as a portrait lens in the 45-75mm range when outside, or perhaps with a flash indoors. Quality drops off at 150mm, but that is very acceptable and you can always crop a photos taken at 120mm if desired. Just buy it, especially if on sale for under one hundred dollars.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Price
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the casing and mount is plastic. However, the image and build quality are great. I don't need a telephoto lens often and this one works just fine when I need the extra reach.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good Performance. Best bang for Your Buck
customer_reviews.text: I am guessing my 1st copy may have had some problems...but this second copy focuses rather quickly and the images it produces are of a high quality...I was shooting some rugby with this lens and it was quick to focus and images are really nice . I also used the x-t1 with the 55-200 by fuji...which many rate as a better camera...and a better lens...I find the images with the Olympus camera and lens much more satisfying...and had more keepers...for 120 bucks this is a keeper...the 55-200 is going back...too slow to focus...and sometimes would not focus at all.This lens is a best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.author: svenlovesflo

customer_reviews.title: Better build quality than i thought
customer_reviews.text: Better build quality than i thought. The 4.0-5.6 aperture hurts but for the price I wouldn't expect better. The lack of image stabilization really hurts at the long end of 150mm, especially with a Panasonic G7 which doesn't have it. Would recommend everyone get one for the extra reach, don't expect miracles. The lens is surprisingly sharp even at 150mm.
customer_reviews.author: obookkenobi

customer_reviews.title: Great micro 4/3 zoom lens at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Great micro 4/3 zoom lens at this price point. This lens is equivalent to an 80-300mm full frame, and gives a nice additional reach if you have the typical 14-42mm kit lens. Build quality is solid. Image quality is quite good and is pretty sharp for a lens of this price. As with most zooms, you do loose sharpness at the long end. Aperture-wise, sharpness is best between f/5.6 to f/8 or so, though eat 150mm sharpness isn't quite as good no matter what the aperture. If you're on a budget, this lens is a great zoom to have in your bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gat821

customer_reviews.title: Wow this lens is inexpensive and of good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great for taking pictures at the zoo, of birds in trees or from the sidelines of a sporting event. This lens is not for taking pictures close up (no family portraits), one would use a different lens for that. Love this lens, for the price it is unbeatable!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Merchak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to the kit lens!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this lens, so much to do with it, I photograph bugs, birds, neighbors 😄. Moon shots are incredible. Basically its the goto lens after the kit lens.
customer_reviews.author: Maor Halpern

customer_reviews.title: Great 4 Thirds Camera Lens
customer_reviews.text: The Olympus M. 40-150mm F4.0-5.6 R Zoom Lens is a great buy for what it cost. It takes great pictures and the zoom feature is smooth with the pictures clear and crisp. This design is of a good quality and the zoom lens looks good too. There are many high end lenses available out there but it can be quite costly hence always keep in mind that what potential you want to achieve. Getting what you need and what you can afford is two separate issues. In this case this Olympus M. 40-150mm F4.0-5.6 R Zoom Lens was exactly what I needed and it was well priced and now serves me well. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Luke Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Must have lens for Oly micro four thirds camera
customer_reviews.text: For the money, its worth to buy!. Great for macro photography (in combination with other cheap lenses), and telephoto. I bought it and shot my first moon pic and was really impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Tirupan

customer_reviews.title: Okay lens, no hood, kind of cheaply built. For the money it is all right
customer_reviews.text: Decent image quality, not great but decent. The build quality is pretty low, plastic mount and super lightweight plastic barrel. Also, it doesn't come with a hood, so that might run you another $20 or $30 and you really need it. If you want a cheap tele zoom for your Olympus OM-D or Pen your choices are limited, however, so I guess you will get this one.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Great focal range at an unbeatable price
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this lense. It covers a large focal range for micro 4/3 at an unbeatable price. 4 stars because image quality is obviously lacking for the pros but for those who need access to zoom lense and aren't expecting professional quality images will be more than happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoors, issues in low light
customer_reviews.text: I have an Olympus Pen EP3 and my normal lens is a 20mm fixed. I wanted a lens with some range and wasn't too keen on purchasing a lens converter for some of my older lenses so was in the market for something with some zoom. This lens is great, it's crisp and clear and focuses quickly! I didn't have much success using it indoors but I plan to mostly use it outside anyway. It's great to be able to step away from your subject (kids!) and capture the shot without altering the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Pennsylvania

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: The pictures are at a feeder in my backyard about 25 feet away. I had my camera on auto, on a tripod, on a 3 second timer to avoid shaking. Kind of overcast, but more than enough light. I have an olympus pen e-pl2. First shot is on auto ON A TRIPOD. Second is that shot cropped. Do NOT waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great image Q for the price
customer_reviews.text: the lens is just amazing if you know how to use it. The quality of it is just impecable and , it has a fast speed when focusing.. to me, it's a saver and a keeper...
customer_reviews.author: Rubs

customer_reviews.title: This lens is for the Birds
customer_reviews.text: This lens is an anniversary gift to my wife, a pro/am photographer. She is using it for nature photography, birds, trees, outdoor stuff. As such, the aperture is perfect. She really appreciates the light weight on her little Oly camera. She has also used it to capture tripod shots of 4th of July fireworks. She feels more "pro than am" now that she has a longer lens. Great price, nice lens, super service and delivery. Totally satisfied with Amazon and their sales fulfillment partners as usual.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Ciolek

customer_reviews.title: Easily one of my favorite lenses!
customer_reviews.text: some of my most favorite pictures have came from this lens! works great with my Lumix G7 all the features work great like your aperture and auto focus. The Lumix doesn't have great auto focus and I rarely use it anyway but when I do it gets you close enough to switch over to manual focus and get it nice and dialed it. I dropped this with my camera off the top of a friends van and it still works! I was rather upset for a second then realized everything was fine! I would recommend this lens to anyone with a micro 4/3 camera!
customer_reviews.author: Durty113

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap, plastic long lens.
customer_reviews.text: You can't get this reach for any cheaper. Got this as a stop gap until I can afford a faster long. It's gotten me through plenty of situations. Picture quality is fine, not nearly as fast as I'd like and variable is annoying. It feels very cheap, but that's because it is. Good cheap plastic lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The no-excuse lens.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and cheerful plastic everything lens. I've owned the precursor of this lens in the larger 4/3 format (not to be confused with the micro 4/3), and this gives you reach in a lens that is light enough to be carried everywhere. If you are planning to travel and visit a European city, I would recommend this lens and a 25mm 1.8. That's it. You won't even need a camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. My 3000+ slide project became manageable again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens to use in a slide duplication project -- I needed something with a longer focal length than my 12-40 mm. Putting it with the slide duplicator that I had failed to focus properly, but I remedied that with a simple +1 close-up lens in between the duplicator and the lens. Works great. My 3000+ slide project became manageable again. Then I began using it for walks along the river in the evening when the deer come out, and it has worked great. An excellent lens, and even better when you can get it at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: J ALLAN CROWSON

customer_reviews.title: Great value for this very handy telephoto
customer_reviews.text: I tend to use prime lenses for my photography and I don't use a lot of long focus lenses. About a year ago I converted from Canon DSLR's to M43, because of the size and weight advantage. I have never looked back. I could not pass up on a lens that gives such exceptional performance for the price and it fits my infrequent need for a telephoto lens very well. I've been pleased with the optical performance. The build quality is certainly more than adequate for my occasional use and very good considering the modest cost. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: mingus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: This lens is amazing considering how cheap it is. From 50-100mm (100-200mm equivalent) range, its optical quality rivals my Canon 70-200mm f4L IS, which costs a thousand dollar more. It does become a little bit softer on 150mm (still very good) and not so good at the 40mm end, but considering the price you would pay, it is an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lang

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR THE $$$
customer_reviews.text: Im shooting on Panasonic GH4 and needed a long range to shoot the sermons at my church. Gave me the range I needed. For the price i really cant complain. Sure there is no OIS, its variable aputure and the build quaility feels cheep, BUT it is something I new i was getting. (tip shoot video with it on tripod, the shakes are intense if not stabilized).
customer_reviews.author: dmaia

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought one of these sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Quick, light, good quality Like the other newer Olympus lenses, this is astonishingly quick to focus and is quite light compared to what I used to carry around in the seventies and eighties. Action is smooth and it's fully coupled with the M43 system, so focal lengths are communicated back and when you twist the focus ring, the system switches into zoom mode. While I'm not about to sell off my legacy lenses, this lens has earned a place in my small travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: Andy BealsTop Contributor: Clarinets

customer_reviews.title: Sharper than you think
customer_reviews.text: This 'cheap' lens takes some impressive photos! I was pretty amazed at how a recent batch came out without a tripod on an older Olympus PEN camera. The lens is mostly made of plastic but for a low price you can't expect this to be a Leica heirloom. I don't take many long lens photos but this will be fine for my needs, e.g., kids sports, wildlife, landscapes. It works fine and like most PEN lenses, doesn't take up a lot of room or weight in the camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Torrison

customer_reviews.title: Wow for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just take simple pictures and bought to take close up of the little one playing. This lens serves the purpose, it's light, it zooms great, and given the price i can just say wow.
customer_reviews.author: RFL

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for the price. I bought it to replace a similar one that I broke. Previous one seemed to give me clearer shots, especially when zoomed in, but maybe I need to use a remote trigger for these shots.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this lens st this price, perfect for the everyday average person who doesn't do photography professionally but occasionally wants to get a closer shot that your kit lens provides
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Slavin

customer_reviews.title: Light, sharp, and well built lens.
customer_reviews.text: This lens delivers a great deal of bang for buck and weight. I love being able to have the reach of an 80-300mm equivalent in a package this tiny and light! My only gripes with the lens (both minor), are that it does feel a bit plasticy, and the lens extends out rather far when zoomed to 150mm. But these are minor pet peeves that don't affect the quality of the results, so I give it a solid 4 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Justin L.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my Olympus
customer_reviews.text: It is a great addition for the price. I’m very glad I picked it up for my trip but still desire more focus strength for future photography projects.
customer_reviews.author: timmahb

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this for the price. Pocket sized zoom lens. Plastic body, but feels very solid, and it's fine for the price. Great images.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thorp

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain zoom
customer_reviews.text: Used on my GH5. Very cheap feel to the lens but great bargain lens Round 100 you can’t beat it for this zoom. Purchased for personal use in nature and it is great choice so far.
customer_reviews.author: Cassanova

customer_reviews.title: No OIS, but incredible photos.
customer_reviews.text: This lens is amazing! Wait for it to go on sale for $99 and I dare you to find a better value. This is my first lens for my Lumix G7 and despite lacking OIS, this thing produces great photos. I'm not a photographer, but I assume this wouldn't be much use for video without a tripod. And for photos you want to be in a stable position. Other than that, just click away to awesome results.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Braquet

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret...!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little treasure !!! I’ve jus started taking pics, let’s say I have no more than four hours into it, and most of this time was spent watching videos about using my camera properly...
customer_reviews.author: Travelin'Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Great price, Great quality, but feels cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Great Lens for the price. purchased this on a package deal. I was able to get this lens for just $100 from Amazon. The original price was $200 and I believe it was on sale for $150. Can't beat that. However the lens is completely built out of plastic, feels cheap, but the image quality is great. For the price, Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Sam W.

customer_reviews.title: Good low cost telephoto zoom lens
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this lens based on the low price, but after reading a lot of positive reviews all over the web, I decided to pick it up. No regrets. While this isn't a fast or durable lens (pretty much all plastic, including the mount connection), it takes some pretty nice photos.
customer_reviews.author: kinojay33

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. The plastic construction isn't all that appealing. For the most part, it gets the job done. The focus isn't that good as you near the end of the focal range.
customer_reviews.author: Schraufabagel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you won't find any other lens as good as this. The aperture is nothing to write home about, and the lens barrel and mount are plastic, but the lens is small and light, the image quality is very good, and the lens focuses very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is super cheap and feels plastic, but its operation and image quality are better than expected. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Lense
customer_reviews.text: Since buying my EP3 Olympus digital camera I've only had the 14mm lens. I've mastered the very basics of the camera and was looking for an economical lens option so I can start taking longer distance photos. This lens has been a great benefit since it's arrival. Not much to know on how to use it, just simply adjust the range and let the camera do the rest. Great quality photos from max 150mm distance. Very impressed for the price compared to others that are equivalent.
customer_reviews.author: J. Prisco

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive for the price. Excellent image quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the most impressive lenses I have ever purchased. It gives me sharp images and excellent bokeh. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Groves

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with this lens, I didn't think I could afford a nice one for my old Olympus but here it is.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor lens
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the cheapest secondary kit lens of the "DSLR-like" cameras I've seen. Like any secondary kit lens it's fairly slow aperture-wise, but the images it takes are super sharp, unlike the garbage 14-40mm kit lens. It also weighs practically nothing. I think it's somehow lighter than my Panasonic 20mm pancake prime! Just don't buy this lens for over $125; I've seen it as low as $99 but it fluctuates a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Widget

customer_reviews.title: A must-have
customer_reviews.text: This is a plastic-bodied lens that has far, far, better image quality than you would expect. I have used a couple of versions of this lens, and both have been exceptional in their rendering. I always recommend this lens for anyone who gets an M43 camera, as it is probably the best value in the entire lineup of lenses at this point.
customer_reviews.author: jalywol18

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It was a great deal and it has hardly left my camera since it arrived. I am a novice photographer and it might not be enough for someone that has a lot of experience but it does exactly what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Vee W.

customer_reviews.title: The best $100 telephoto lens
customer_reviews.text: It's a $100 300mm full frame equivalent lens, nothing can beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Nice zoom
customer_reviews.text: I have been using APS dSLR for 10 years and just picked up a e-pm1 recently as a walk around setup. When the price of this lens dropped by 25%, I picked up one. The zoom ring is not as smooth as the 14-42 but it is OK. Focus is fast. Optically, it is very good. I had Tamron 70-300 but was not too impressed. This 40-150 is cheaper and actually impresses me quite a bit. When compared to higher end lenses, it is not too shabby either.
customer_reviews.author: PhotographerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great little lens
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my black magic pocket cinema 4K camera .. lens is good for the price . Bokeh is nice. Wanted to invest into something sinple instead just going out and buying expensive cinema lenses
customer_reviews.author: Geekryderz

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: A good lens for the price. Lightweight, too. I prefer the Panasonic 35-100 f/4-5.6, because it is a lot smaller and is also stabilised. However, the Olympus does have a longer zoom reach.
customer_reviews.author: newzild

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance of price and usefulness!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on sale for $99.00 and I can't ask for more. It is the perfect balance of price and usefulness. Images looks great and having this much reach on the MFT platform is just awesome. Even at $199.00 I would not hesitate to recommend this lens. I was shooting in doors at night with 1600 ISO and handheld on my OMD EM1 with sharp results fully extended.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett G. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hundred dollar lens you can find in the micro4/3ds system and it's surprisingly versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Psuedominimalist

customer_reviews.title: Very good, sharp
customer_reviews.text: Very good, sharp. Used on GH4, in video it is focusing very well and smooth. Light weight. Only one "disadvantage" that on GH4 with crop it too much zoom at 40mm for me, but it is not issue with lens. I can recommended, especially for that price it is great! Compare with my expensive Canon lenses, and this is not worse.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D

customer_reviews.title: Great lens at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I came from a point and shoot camera so this was the first camera I've had with interchangable lenses. This lens take great pictures and has great bokah. I used it today and shot some wildlife and the pictures were beautiful-clear and crisp with the background blurred just perfect. I also did some pictures at a seminary near my house that has beautiful building and bridges and they came out great. I am very happy with with this lens. It's pretty fast too.
customer_reviews.author: Lake girl

customer_reviews.title: It’s alrightish
customer_reviews.text: I like this lens but it feels cheap if I’m being honest. It does get pretty close but not if you’re trying to take photos at a football game or a volley ball game.
customer_reviews.author: Adam river

customer_reviews.title: Excellent telephoto lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent telephoto zoom for micro four thirds. Impressively sharp on my EM1. If you want to play around with longer focal lengths, you cannot go wrong with this inexpensive lens. The lens feels solid enough in hand. The zoom action is a little stiff on my copy. The lens mount is plastic. Sharpness in the center is incredible regardless of cost. I only wish that it was weathersealed.
customer_reviews.author: FCo

customer_reviews.title: Good lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens works great, I have been getting decent photos from it.
customer_reviews.author: Croz

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for the price. Decent sharpness even at 300mm. AF hunts a lot at higher focal lengths but I wouldn't complain. for $99 it's an incredible value.
customer_reviews.author: Waisenkind

customer_reviews.title: exactly what it should be
customer_reviews.text: this lense gives great quality photos of far away objects :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for the price. I am using it on a Lumix GF7.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Rios

customer_reviews.title: But it does produce some very nice photos none the less
customer_reviews.text: It works very well but 4 stars for build quality being all plastic construction , no weather sealing even plastic mount. But it does produce some very nice photos none the less. For the price on sale of $100 or less you have to get one.
customer_reviews.author: gntlmndan

customer_reviews.title: Great Zoom
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Increased the quality of my photos 100%
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Steen

customer_reviews.title: Good range, sharpness and price.
customer_reviews.text: Optics are good enough to get good pictures on full range. Cost - benefit hardly insuperable. After using for a period of time, it became one of my favorite lens. So I move from four to five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Bertens

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for the price. No stabilization while using it with my Panasonic LUMIX but I knew that when buying it. So it’s not a fault of the lens but I do wish it had built in stabilization
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Chernochan

customer_reviews.title: Good solution for the cost
customer_reviews.text: The Lumix Micro 4/3 body is now my carry-around camera because it's small, light and yields excellent quality. This lens extends my reach but does it at the expense of lens speed. That keeps cost down, of course, but be prepared to work at higher ISOs and slower shutter speeds.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Behm

customer_reviews.title: A good light lens
customer_reviews.text: I got this lens at a low price, and for the money it is quite good optically, very small and light. It is of largely plastic construction, but seems durable enough if you do not abuse it. When I want to travel light, I take it with my Olympus M10 and the 14-42 mm lens for a very compact and capable kit.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ogorzalek

customer_reviews.title: quite a steal at $119
customer_reviews.text: I got this for $119 which is really a steal. Takes good pics. Color looks natural. I have not noticed distortions beyond the 70mm range. Maybe my old eyes can't see them anymore. The only thing I don't like about this lens is it's mostly plastic. Well, I know it's one reason why it's cheap compared to Lumix. But it's the performance that counts most, isn't it?
customer_reviews.author: Mali John

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price and very useful
customer_reviews.text: Very good lens for walk around because of range. Price was great.
customer_reviews.author: E. Headrick

customer_reviews.title: very happy
customer_reviews.text: I am an ameture photographer and have an olympus epl-3. This lense is my go to so far! The zoom is just right for wjat I have needed! I even put a few magnifying lenses onto this and was able to get some amazing macro shots! I feel like for the money this was well worth it! I know there are better lenses out there but being a beginner i have been thrilled with the results!
customer_reviews.author: Sgraham

customer_reviews.title: Works just as advertised.  Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter to go along with her Olympus camera she already has. She wanted a telescoping lens to take pictures further away. She's just getting into cameras and taking pictures so this is by no means top of the line but for someone starting out, this is perfect. She absolutely loves it and I was definitely surprised at how it works. For the price, it's definitely hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I love it and it fits with my lumix g7
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Skyler( That Fivelily )

customer_reviews.title: Great starter lens
customer_reviews.text: Just getting started adding lenses to my Panasonic G 7 & this is a good starter lens. Does not have stabilization built in lens like Panasonic as Olympus has their stabilization built in camera. I use it for outdoor sport pictures in good light but limited when sun goes down.
customer_reviews.author: Mckaty

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good for a ridiculously low price
customer_reviews.text: I did a side-by side comparison with the 12-40 mm F2.8 on my E-M5 Mk. II. At 40 mm and F6.3, the inexpensive 40-150 looks just a bit sharper in the center than the "pro" glass! At 150 mm its a little less sharp but still respectable performance. Its lightweight plastic construction may limit its durability but at this price you can buy another when it wears out! Until the Lens Fairy leaves me a 40-150 mm F2.8 this will serve nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Badger13

customer_reviews.title: Useful, Low-Priced Lens
customer_reviews.text: Considering it's price ($99) and plastic construction, the lens is quite sharp. I'm concerned about it's durability, especially the plastic mount.
customer_reviews.author: AMCan

customer_reviews.title: Good lens for general photos
customer_reviews.text: The range of this lens is perfect for most of the photography that I do. Normal photos taken inside a room to things further out where you can't quite get as close as you would like. I also have the lens that goes up to 300 so this one will be a nice compliment to that one. Not a burden to carry around either as some of the older lens that weigh more can be.
customer_reviews.author: Randy B

customer_reviews.title: Arrived promptly. Initial impression is that lens, though ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly. Initial impression is that lens, though the body is plastic, is still well made and certainly lightweight. Have not put it to test yet on camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Zoom lense for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use during the solar eclipse of Aug. 2017 worked as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: GmoneyTenn

customer_reviews.title: amazing long lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical with the price of this lens. However, after significant use on a month-long road trip, this sucker is amazing. I cannot believe it was only ~$150. After doing some later checking on the micro 4/3 site, it appears this is well documented. For those who venture into other spectrums of light, do not hesitate. This lens performed flawlessly in Infrared with zero hot spots.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted something to zoom a bit. I wasn't expecting such a great lens. It does feel cheap, but it takes really good telephoto shots with pretty good depth of field.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B

customer_reviews.title: Low Price - High Quality and Clarity
customer_reviews.text: This is great glass at an amazing price for the Micro 4/3 lens system. You really can't go wrong with this guy. HUGE zoom and great pictures. I'm very amature, but a couple of shots I've taken with this guy have already been published. It's pretty cool and I recommend this lens very highly for people getting into photography.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is a $99 lens. I should have expected a cheap look. I needed a long lens and I was in a pinch so I bought this. I would avoid this product if you are not desperate for a zoom lens.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Roze

customer_reviews.title: It is sharp and easy to use and balances with the camera very well
customer_reviews.text: I am using this lens on a Lumix camera. It is sharp and easy to use and balances with the camera very well. The only downside has to do with the fact that the anti-shake function does not work on the Lumix camera. Zooming out to the equivalent of 300 mm requires extra care in holding the camera steady. Still, a very good lens at a good price. The lens arrived in excellent condition and on time.
customer_reviews.author: Don Camp

product_meta.title: Olympus M.Zuiko Digital ED 40-150mm F4.0-5.6 R Zoom Lens, for Micro Four Thirds Cameras (Black)
product_meta.description: Style:40-150mm F4.0-5.6| *:Black| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe latest generation of the M.Zuiko Digital ED 40-150 mm f4.0-5.6 R (35mm equivalent focal length: 80-300 mm) has now arrived. It features a brand new, optimized overall design in a stylish black body. It's small, lightweight and variable in performance - perfect for close-up portraits or long-distance scenes - and it is flexible for indoor or outdoor use. You can use this high-power zoom as the perfect companion of your standard kit lens without being burdened by travelling with too much equipment. It features an MSC (Movie and Still Compatible) focusing mechanism that is designed to deliver quiet and precise operation, for an affordable, high quality means to capture your life in still images or HD videos.
feature_bullets: Macro focus range: 90 centimeter, focal length: 40 to 150 millimeter
Lightweight, portable design, 80 to 300 millimeter equivalent field of view
Nearly silent movie and still compatible auto focus, perfect choice for second lens
Great for portraits and sports; Maximum reproduction ratio:- 1:6.25

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars940 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
